title: [bug] iOS config being used for Android app

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

body:
### Describe the bug

I was building my android app when it gave me an error that it couldn't find the directory `gen/android\app/src/main\java/my/domain/appname/apple`.

So I was like: huh why /apple when building android?

I only have the .apple suffix in the `tauri.ios.conf.json` file
```json
{
  "identifier": "my.domain.appname.apple"
}
```
In the main config file it is just `my.domain.appname`.

So I did rename the ios config file to _tauri.ios.conf.json and then it worked fine.
I even tried adding `tauri.android.conf.json` file, but it didn't help.

Seems like a bug to me

### Reproduction

Make an `tauri.ios.conf.json` file:
```json
{
  "identifier": "my.domain.appname.apple"
}
```

make it the same as your main config file but add a suffix

### Expected behavior

I was expecting my android build to NOT use the ios config.

### Additional context
